byline.contributor: Rick Lyman reported from Warsaw, and Helene Bienvenu from Budapest.
byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and HELENE BIENVENU

abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin meets Hungarian Prime Min Viktor Orban in low-key visit; many Hungarians view Russia with distaste, remembering years of Communist rule, but they also want economic vitality; Hungary wants to better Western relations.
lead_paragraph: A trip to Hungary by President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was a far cry from the triumphant reception he received in Serbia in October. Mr. Putin kept largely out of public view in Budapest.

headline.main: Hungary Keeps Visit by Putin Low-Key as It Seeks to Repair Relations With West
headline.print_headline: Hungary Keeps Visit by Putin Low-Key as It Seeks to Repair Relations With West

snippet: A trip to Hungary by President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was a far cry from the triumphant reception he received in Serbia in October. Mr. Putin kept largely out of public view in Budapest.
